content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 801.8 - Recording criteria for needlesticks and sharps injuries

State Regulations
(a) The employer must record all work-related
needlestick injuries and cuts from sharp objects that are contaminated with
another person's blood or other potentially infectious material (as defined by
29 CFR
1910.1030
). The employer must enter the case
on the SH 900 log as an injury. To protect the employee's privacy, the employer
must treat needlestick injuries and cuts from sharp objects that are
contaminated with another person's blood, or other potentially infectious
material, as a privacy concern case as defined in section
801.29
(b) and (c)
of this Part. Notes
